title.narrative: Local Economy and Infrastructure Development Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Local Economy and Infrastructure Development Project for Armenia is to improve infrastructure services and institutional capacity for increased tourism contribution to local economy in selected regions of Armenia. The project comprises of three components. The first component, heritage hub regeneration and tourism circuit development will comprise of four sub-components: (i) heritage hub regeneration; (ii) development of the tourism circuits; (iii) public-private investment (PPI); and (iv) project management, designs, and construction supervision. The second component, institutional development will increase the institutional capacity and performance of the Development Foundation Armenia (DFA), Ministry of Economy (MoE), the Historical and Culture Heritage Protection Agency (HCHPA), project implementing entity and other local and regional entities. The third component, contingent emergency response (CER) can be used to channel additional funds should they become available as a result of the emergency.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Supervisory Board | Description :The Borrower shall maintain the Project Steering Committee of the ProjectImplementing Entity. (Loan Agreement: Schedule 2, Section I.A.1) | Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to implement the ESMF. (LoanAgreement: Schedule 2, Section I.D.1.a) | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Resettlement Policy Framework | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity toimplement the RPF. (Loan Agreement: Schedule 2, Section I.D.2.a) | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redress Mechanism | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to establishand implement, throughout the Project implementation, an easily accessible grievance redress mechanism, acceptable to the Bank, toaddress feedback and grievances relating to the Project as set forth in the Operation Manual. (Loan Agreement: Schedule 2, SectionD.3) | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :International Waterways | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to ensure, whenany activity under an Investment Subproject involves any international waterways (as defined in the Bank's OP 7.50), to comply withthe requirements set out in Loan Agreement: Schedule 2, Section 1.D.4. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Selection Procedures for and Terms and Conditions of Investment Subproject Financing | Description :InvestmentSubprojects shall be selected in accordance with the selection criteria set forth in the Operations Manual and the ProjectAgreement (Project Agreement: Schedule, Section I.A.1.a) | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Increased number of people in urban areas provided with access to all-season roads within a 500 meter range under the project
Increased average number of hours per day of piped water services in project areas.
Increased number of jobs created by activities linked to support tourism industry (gender disaggregated)
Number of destination management offices established and operational to ensure sustainability.
Beneficiaries that feel Project investments reflected their needs
Production and distribution of new Tourism maps
Grievances responded to within 2 weeks of being filed (%)
Number of beneficiaries of skills development training provided by the Project, disaggregated by gender
Improved access roads to selected tourism attraction sites.
Increased number of tourism-related SMEs at Project sites (e.g., souvenir and handcraft shops, family and guest houses, restaurants, museums, etc.), disaggregated by gender
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits addressed
Preparation of Site Management Plans for key cultural heritage sites
Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project
Working age population in Project areas engaged in non-farm employment (disaggregated)
Increased number of visitors to Project sites
Number of street lighting posts and bulbs replaced/installed
Number of tourism facilities constructed at the cultural heirtage sites along the tourist circuit
